variant.question: Engine 2 powers:

options.text: The yellow system pump and the green system via the PTU should green system pump fail.

variant.question: The yellow system comprises:

options.text: One engine driven pump, one electric pump, one hand pump.
One engine driven pump, two electric pumps.
One engine driven pump, one hand pump and the RAT.

variant.question: The load alleviation function accumulators operate in case of high demands on:

options.text: The yellow and blue powered spoilers.
The blue and green powered spoilers.
The yellow and green powered spoilers 4 + 5 and ailerons.

variant.question: With PTU in AUTO, the PTU automatically runs:

options.text: If the blue hydraulic system is lost.
When differential pressure between green and yellow system is more than 500 psi.
As soon as a differential pressure between green and yellow system is detected.

variant.question: With green and yellow hydraulic systems lost, manual pitch trim is:
With the green system only remaining, the auto brake is:
With only hydraulic blue system remaining:

options.text: Seven full brake applications are available.

variant.question: The green system operates:
Normal hydraulic power is provided by:

options.text: Engine driven pumps for all systems.
Engine driven pumps for green and yellow, electric pump for blue, electric pump for yellow (ground operation only).
Electric pumps for blue and yellow, engine driven pumps for green.
Engine driven pumps for green and blue electric pump for yellow.

variant.question: The power transfer unit is:

options.text: One way between green and yellow.

variant.question: In flight, if blue electric pump fails the blue system:
With both engines shutdown, how is it possible to pressurize the green system?

options.text: By the yellow engine pump and the PTU.
By the yellow electric pump and the PTU.

variant.question: The RAT is automatically extended in case of:

options.text: Blue pump delivery pressure dropping below 1750 psi.

variant.question: On ground the blue system is pressurized when:
Which Statement about the Ram Air Turbine (RAT) is correct?

options.text: The RAT does not deploy automatically
The RAT deploy automatically if the BLUE hydraulic system pressure is lost only
The RAT deploy automatically, if AC BUS 1 and AC BUS 2 are both lost only
The RAT deploy automatically, if the BLUE hydraulic system pressure is lost or If AC BUS 1 and AC BUS 2 are both lost

variant.question: If BLUE system is lost, SLAT/FLAP operation is:
The priority valves operate in case of:

options.text: High hydraulic pressure in the GREEN system
Cuts off hydraulic power to heavy load user systems if hydraulic pressure in a system gets low
High hydraulic pressure in the GREEN and YELLOW systems
High pressure in the BLUE system

variant.question: In case of a system reservoir overheat, the fault light stays on:

options.text: As long as the overheat lasts
As long as the associated pump switch ist NOT switched OFF

variant.question: You get a G RSVR OVHT ECAM message. Why does the ECAM procedure ask you to switch the PTU off first?

options.text: You want to prevent the hot hydraulic fluid from being transferred to the YELLOW system
You want to depressurize the YELLOW and GREEN systems
You want to prevent the BLUE system from pressurizing the GREEN system
You want to stop the PTU from pressurizing the GREEN system

variant.question: What is the normal pressure in the hydraulic system?
Normal hydraulic power is provided by

options.text: Engine driven pumps for all systems
Engine driven pumps for GREEN and YELLOW, Electrical pump for blue, Electrical pump for YELLOW (ground operation only)
Electrical pumps for BLUE and YELLOW, Engine driven pump for GREEN system
Engine driven pumps for GREEN and BLUE systems and Electrical pump for YELLOW system

variant.question: You have started engine 2, but the PTU has not operated to pressurize the GREEN hydraulic system. Why not?

options.text: The PTU has been switched OFF.
The PTU can only pressurize the BLUE system.
he PTU will not operate until the second engine has been started.
The PTU can only pressurize the YELLOW system.

variant.question: You get a G RSVR OVHT message. Why does the ECAM procedure ask you to switch the PTU off first?

options.text: You want to prevent the hot hydraulic fluid from being transferred to the YELLOW system.
You want to depressurize the YELLOW and GREEN systems.
You want to prevent the BLUE system from pressurizing the GREEN system.
You want to stop the PTU from pressurizing the GREEN system.

variant.question: What is the normal pressure in the hydraulic system?
During start up, when is the BLUE hydraulic system pressurized?

options.text: As soon as the PTU is turned on.
As soon as the BLUE electric pump is manually turned on.
As soon as the engine master sw is set to IGN/START

variant.question: With reference to the PTU, which statement is correct?

options.text: The PTU enables the GREEN and YELLOW system to pressurize each other.
The YELLOW system can supply the BLUE and GREEN systems.
The PTU only allows the YELLOW system to pressurize the GREEN system.
The PTU must be manually selected on for it to work.

variant.question: In a case the RAT is deployed, the following statement is true:

options.text: Blue hydraulic system and emergency generator are available

variant.question: Under which conditions does the RAT deploy automatically?

options.text: Green and Yellow Hydraulic systems are lost
AC BUS 1 and Blue Hydraulic system are lost.

variant.question: In flight, if BLUE electric pump fails the BLUE system:

options.text: Can be recovered by the RAT
Can be recovered by the PTU
Can be recovered by the PSU

variant.question: What does the RAT MAN ON Pb do?

options.text: Extends the RAT, pressurizes the BLUE hydraulic system, does not couple the Emergency Generator
Extends the RAT, pressurizes the BLUE hydraulic system, couples the Emergency Generator to the electrical system
Extends the RAT, to get hydraulic power the RAT MAN ON Pb must be pressed a second time
Extends the RAT, pressurizes the YELLOW hydraulic system and starts the Emergency Generator

variant.question: How many source systems provide pressure to the YELLOW SYS?

options.text: 3 (one electrical driven pump, one mechanical driven pump & one accumulator)
4 (one electrical driven pump, one mechanical driven pump, one accumulator & PTU)
4 (one electrical driven & one mechanical driven pump & one accumulator & the RAT)

variant.question: If the RAT pressurizes the BLUE hydraulic system, the operating pressure is approximately ____.
With green hydraulic low pressure the alternate brake system has the same capabilities as normal brakes except:

options.text: Antiskid is inoperative due to switching off the A/SKID & N/W STRG according to the Procedure

variant.question: After deploying the ram air turbine (RAT), is it possible to check its position and status?

options.text: Yes, check to see if the blue system ELEC PUMP OFF light is illuminated or the “RAT” Memo on the upper ECAM Display
Yes, on the ECAM ELEC page and in the MEMO of the upper ECAM (RAT OUT)
Yes, on the ECAM HYD page and in the MEMO of the upper ECAM (RAT OUT)

variant.question: When will normal operation of the BLUE system hydraulic pump begin?

options.text: As soon as one engine is running
When the first engine MASTER switch is moved to the ON position
Only when the RAT is deployed

Engine 2 hydraulic pump - The yellow electric pump - The RAT.

Cuts off hydraulic power to heavy load user systems if hydraulic pressure in a system gets low.

The blue hydraulic system is pressurized and the emergency generator is running.

options.text: From engine one or the crossbleed duct.

options.text: On the ground and in flight.

options.text: As long as the overheat is detected.

When extended in flight the RAT pressurizes:

options.text: The yellow system and the green system via the PTU.

variant.question: Which elevator does the yellow system operate:
During the first engine start the PTU is:
During the second engine start the PTU is:
What does a FAULT light in the PTU pb switch indicate?

options.text: GREEN or YELLOW reservoir low air pressure
GREEN or YELLOW reservoir low level

variant.question: What happens when the ground crew move the cargo door manual selector either to OPEN or CLOSE position (aircraft is electrically powered)?

options.text: The yellow electrical pump is automatically energized and pressurizes the entire yellow system
The yellow electrical pump is automatically energized and the yellow system is partly pressurized (Cargo Doors and alternate braking only)
The cargo door will not move until the yellow electrical pump is switched on with the pushbutton on the cockpit hydraulic panel
The yellow electrical pump is automatically energized, the yellow system is partly pressurized (cargo doors, engine 2 reverse and alternate braking only)

variant.question: Which statement about the YELLOW electrical Pump is correct?

options.text: The YELLOW electrical pump will be used immidiatly after an “HYD Y ENG 2 PUMP LO PR” ECAM caution
When the pump is switched on, the YELLOW system will only be partially pressurized (cargo doors, braking and engine 2 reverse only)
The electric pump can also pressurize the system, which allows YELLOW hydraulics to be used on the ground when the engines are stopped
When the pump is switched ON on ground, the PTU is inhibited automatically and only the YELLOW system will be pressurized

variant.question: Which conditions activate a FAULT light on the hydraulic engine driven pump Pb?

options.text: Reservoir low-level / reservoir overheat / reservoir low air pressure / pump overheat
Reservoir low-level / reservoir overheat / reservoir low air pressure / pump low pressure
Reservoir low-level / reservoir overheat / reservoir low air pressure / pump low pressure / pump overheat

variant.question: In case on an engine 1 failure at lift-off....

options.text: All hydraulic systems remain available but the landing gear retraction is rate reduced because the green system capacity is limited due to the PTU
All hydraulic systems remain fully available, only the G ENG 1 PUMP is inop
The only normal working hydraulic system remains the yellow. The green system is flow limited via the PTU and the blue system is lost as a consequence of the loss of generator 1
The only normal working hydraulic system remains the yellow. The green system is flow limited via the PTU

variant.question: What main components are powered by the yellow hydraulic system?

options.text: NWS, Alternate brake system, Reverser ENG 2 and Stabilizer
Normal brakes, Slats and Flaps, Wing tip brakes and Stabilizer
Rudder, Emergency generator, Slats , L and R Elevator
Cargo Doors, Ram Air Turbine and the Landing gear

variant.question: The power transfer unit (PTU) starts operation automatically when the differential pressure between the GREEN and the YELLOW systems is greater than ___.
When does the PTU start operating?

options.text: When the differential Pressure between GREEN and YELLOW System is higher than 500 PSI
When the PTU pb switch is manually switched ON
During first Engine Start until the end of the entire engine Start sequence of both engines (switching the ENG MODE SEL to NORM)

variant.question: How many Spoilers are still operating during YELLOW and GREEN hydraulic failure (BLUE system remaining)?
A PTU (Power Transfer Unit) enables:

options.text: Fluid transfer from the YELLOW to the GREEN system
Fluid transfer from the YELLOW to the BLUE system
The YELLOW system to pressurize the GREEN system and vice versa
The YELLOW system to pressurize the BLUE system and vice versa

variant.question: The hydraulic reservoirs are pressurized:

options.text: By pressurized bleed air from PACK 1 and PACK 2
By pressurized bleed air from cross bleed duct only
By a spring loaded bi-directional piston in each reservoir
By high pressure bleed air from engine number one or, if insufficient, by bleed air from the cross bleed duct
